tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE weather_alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    alert_type VARCHAR(255),
    severity VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE weather_alerts (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    alert_type VARCHAR(50),
    alert_message TEXT,
    alert_time TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE user_notifications (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    notification_type VARCHAR(50),
    message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

CREATE TABLE WeatherAlerts (
  alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  alert_type VARCHAR(50),
  alert_description TEXT,
  alert_level VARCHAR(20),
  alert_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE UserNotifications (
  notification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  notification_type VARCHAR(50),
  notification_message TEXT,
  notification_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES UserLocations(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE weather_alerts (
	a_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	a_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	a_description TEXT,
	a_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
	a_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
	a_severity VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE user_notifications (
	n_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	n_user_id INT NOT NULL,
	n_alert_id INT NOT NULL,
	n_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
	n_is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE
);

CREATE TABLE users (
	u_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	u_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
	u_email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
	u_phone_number VARCHAR(20),
	u_location VARCHAR(100)
);
